intro: Dysoxylum trukense, commonly known as the Truk Island hibiscus, is a tropical tree native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and humid conditions. Its fruits are capsule-like and contain seeds that are dispersed by wind. Dysoxylum trukense plays a role in local ecosystems and has cultural significance in some island communities.
